content.description:
Aeneas and Achates gain a bird’s-eye view.

1 Corripuere viam interea, qua semitasemita, -ae, f. path monstrat.

Iamque ascendebant collem, qui plurimus urbi

imminet,immineo, -ere: loom above adversasque aspectat desuper arces.

Miratur molem Aeneas, magaliamagal, -alis, n.: hut quondam,

5 miratur portas strepitumquestrepitus, -us, m.: noise et strata viarum.
content.question: The case and number of strata (line 5) are

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
